alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:12AM EDT until April 07 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL HARNETT AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAKE COUNTIES... At 812 AM EDT, Local law enforcement reports multiple road closures, including intersection of NC-55 and Highway 42 in Fuquay-Varina, as well as a stranded vehicle due to flash flooding. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Holly Springs, Lake Wheeler, Lake Benson and Duncan. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
